page.title: 01HECKMONDWIKE AND DISTRICT 1.
page.content: The industrial towns of Heckmondwike and Batley along with the adjacent suburban villages of Livesedge, Gomersal, Birstall Smithies and Staincliffe lie in the heart of the W.Yorkshire connurbation. Industrial development comprises the remnants of a woolen textile industry. The area specialised in 'shoddy', that is the reclaiming of wool fibres from old clothes, rags and waste to clean, spin and weave. Industrial decline has left many valley floor mills demolished empty or used for other business. The mill chimney is a rare sight in the 1980's. Most industrial development is also in the valley bottoms along Spen and Batley Becks. Metalworking and mechanical engineering had origins in the woollen industry but industrial structure has diversified including paint,chemicals and sportswear firms.
